terms.definition: Something exciting, excellent, or amazing
terms.example: That party last night was so lit, everyone was dancing until 3 AM.

terms.definition: To do something really well or successfully; to excel

translations.Boomers: knock it out of the park

terms.example: She really slayed that presentation and got a standing ovation.

terms.definition: Someone who follows mainstream trends without originality
terms.example: He's so basic with his pumpkin spice latte and North Face jacket.

terms.definition: Being aware of social injustices and issues
terms.example: She's pretty woke about climate issues and participates in activism.

terms.definition: Expression of indifference or dismissal
terms.example: I told him to clean his room and he just said 'whatever' and kept scrolling on his phone.

terms.definition: Excellent, cool, or impressive
terms.example: Those new Jordan shoes are totally rad!

terms.definition: Excellent, cool, or wonderful
terms.example: That's a groovy tune, man. Turn it up!

terms.definition: Amazing or extraordinary
terms.example: That Hendrix concert was far out, man! Best show ever!

terms.definition: To throw something with force or express excitement
terms.example: He yeeted his backpack onto the couch from across the room.

terms.definition: Assessing someone's mood or attitude
terms.example: Just doing a vibe check to see how everyone's feeling before we start the meeting.

terms.definition: Not lying, telling the truth
terms.example: No cap, that was the best movie I've seen all year.

terms.definition: Suspicious or questionable
terms.example: That guy was acting kinda sus when we asked about the missing cookies.

terms.definition: Subtle or secretly
terms.example: I'm lowkey obsessed with that new Netflix show but don't want everyone to know.

terms.definition: Obviously or openly
terms.example: I'm highkey stressed about this final exam tomorrow.

terms.definition: Expression of agreement or affirmation
terms.example: Want to get pizza later? Bet!

terms.definition: Fake or secondary Instagram account for private posts
terms.example: I only post my real thoughts and unfiltered photos on my finsta.

terms.definition: Fear of missing out, anxiety about missing social events
terms.example: I have such FOMO seeing everyone's concert pictures on Instagram.

terms.definition: Performing adult responsibilities and tasks
terms.example: I'm adulting today by paying my bills, doing laundry, and meal prepping for the week.

terms.definition: Looking good, stylish, or put together
terms.example: Your outfit is snatched today! Where did you get those jeans?

terms.definition: Being completely serious
terms.example: I'm deadass about to quit my job after how they treated me today.

terms.definition: To suddenly cut off all communication with someone
terms.example: He ghosted me after our second date, not even a text back.

terms.definition: A seemingly modest statement that actually draws attention to something impressive
terms.example: Ugh, I'm so tired from my vacation in the Maldives - humble brag!

terms.definition: To pretend to be someone else online
terms.example: I think I'm being catfished because he won't video chat and his photos look too professional.

terms.definition: Cool, high quality, especially relating to memes
terms.example: That's a pretty dank meme, I'm saving it to my collection.

terms.definition: Subtle, indirect disrespect or criticism
terms.example: She was throwing shade the entire conversation, talking about 'some people' but clearly meaning me.

terms.definition: Expression of approval or agreement
terms.example: We're going to the new Marvel movie tonight. Cool beans!

terms.definition: Expression of disbelief or rejection
terms.example: He asked me to clean his room for him. As if I would ever do that!

terms.definition: Dismissive phrase indicating unwillingness to listen
terms.example: Talk to the hand because I'm not listening to your excuses anymore.

terms.definition: Expression used to indicate you were joking after making a statement
terms.example: I did your homework for you... Psyche! Do it yourself.

terms.definition: Expression of disgust or dislike
terms.example: Gag me with a spoon, those shoes with that dress? Terrible combination.

terms.definition: Fashionable or currently popular
terms.example: That's a very hip hairstyle you have, very modern.

terms.definition: To talk or chat
terms.example: Let's rap about this problem later when we have more time.

terms.definition: Money or cash
terms.example: I need to make some bread for rent this month, maybe pick up an extra shift.

terms.definition: To understand or appreciate something
terms.example: I really dig that new Beatles-inspired band, they've got great harmonies.

terms.definition: Stay relaxed, don't worry
terms.example: Just hang loose, everything will be fine with the job interview.

terms.definition: Serious, deep, or profound
terms.example: That was a heavy conversation about the meaning of life and our purpose.

terms.definition: Request to stop an annoying behavior
terms.example: Can you not click your pen repeatedly? It's driving me crazy.

terms.definition: To be an extremely devoted fan
terms.example: I stan that singer so much, I've been to all her concerts this year.

terms.definition: Greatest Of All Time
terms.example: Michael Jordan is the GOAT of basketball, no one comes close.

terms.definition: Extremely awkward or embarrassing
terms.example: That speech was so cringe I couldn't watch, he kept forgetting his lines.

terms.definition: A humorous way to reference being emotionally affected
terms.example: When my mom said I couldn't have ice cream... emotional damage!

terms.definition: Someone who acts predictably or without originality
terms.example: He always orders vanilla ice cream like such an npc, never tries anything new.

terms.definition: A sudden feeling of disgust that ruins attraction
terms.example: He chewed with his mouth open and it gave me the ick immediately.

terms.definition: Charm or ability to attract a romantic partner
terms.example: That guy has no rizz, he couldn't get a date if he tried.

terms.definition: Someone who shows excessive admiration for someone else, especially romantically
terms.example: He's such a simp, he buys her gifts every day even though she doesn't like him back.

terms.definition: Introducing a profound or absurd thought, as if high
terms.example: Hits blunt: What if water is just air in liquid form?

terms.definition: A really good song
terms.example: This new Taylor Swift song is such a bop, I've had it on repeat all day.

terms.definition: An entitled or demanding person, typically a woman
terms.example: She asked to speak to the manager because her coffee wasn't hot enough. Such a karen.

terms.definition: A feeling or atmosphere; to relax and enjoy oneself
terms.example: I'm just here to vibe and enjoy the music, not to socialize.

terms.definition: A lie or exaggeration
terms.example: He said he's met Taylor Swift, but that's cap. He's never even been to a concert.

terms.definition: Mediocre or average quality
terms.example: That new movie was mid. Not terrible but definitely not worth the hype.

terms.definition: Something that is extremely good, especially referring to food
terms.example: This pizza is bussin! Best I've had in months.

terms.definition: To gossip or share information/news
terms.example: Come on, spill the tea about what happened at the party last night.

terms.definition: Someone who is fashionable, interesting, or admirable
terms.example: That jazz musician is such a cool cat with his sunglasses and smooth style.

terms.definition: A job or performance, especially a musician's engagement
terms.example: My band has a gig at the local bar this weekend.

terms.definition: When someone or something is constantly in your thoughts
terms.example: That song is living rent-free in my head all week.

terms.definition: Something or someone that is excellent or impressive
terms.example: That concert was the bomb! I had such a great time.

terms.definition: An expression of discomfort, embarrassment, or pain
terms.example: Oof, that rejection must have hurt.

terms.definition: Money or wealth
terms.example: I need to get this bread so I can buy a new laptop.

terms.definition: To be absolutely certain about something
terms.example: You can bet your bottom dollar that he'll be late again.

terms.definition: Fashionable, high-quality outfit or style
terms.example: His drip is unmatched at the party with those designer shoes.

terms.definition: A suggestion to calm down or relax
terms.example: Take a chill pill, it's not that serious.

terms.definition: Information from the original or authoritative source
terms.example: I heard straight from the horse's mouth that they're closing the store.

terms.definition: Being oneself without caring about others' opinions; agreeable
terms.example: That's a based opinion, I totally agree with your take.

terms.definition: Cool, impressive, or excellent
terms.example: That new skateboard trick was tight!

terms.definition: Someone who acts without restraint, often being brutally honest
terms.example: She was savage when she told him exactly what she thought of his presentation.

terms.definition: Something that doesn't appeal to one's tastes or preferences
terms.example: Horror movies are not my cup of tea, I prefer comedies.

terms.definition: Something that has a unique, usually better, effect or feeling
terms.example: Listening to that song at night hits different.

terms.definition: Extremely good or exciting; also can mean free from obligation
terms.example: That party was off the hook, I've never danced so much.

terms.definition: A euphemism for someone who has died, particularly in a violent way
terms.example: If you don't pay back the loan, you might end up sleeping with the fishes.

terms.definition: To show off or boast about something
terms.example: He's always flexing his new car on social media.

terms.definition: To remain relaxed and casual; take it easy
terms.example: Just hang loose this weekend, we don't have any plans.

terms.definition: To be tricked, deceived, or taken advantage of
terms.example: I can't believe I got got by that fake email scam.

terms.definition: Excellent or impressive; extreme
terms.example: That was a radical skateboard move you just did!

terms.definition: Acting crazy, overreacting, or being paranoid
terms.example: Why are you buggin about a little rain? We'll be fine.

terms.definition: Something that's awesome or impressive
terms.example: That new song is straight gas!

terms.definition: To leave quickly or be forced to leave
terms.example: It's getting late, time for 23 skidoo!

terms.definition: A loss or failure
terms.example: I failed my driving test again. That's a big L.

terms.definition: A win or success
terms.example: Getting tickets to that sold-out concert was a huge W.

terms.definition: Mentally absent or not paying attention
terms.example: He's completely out to lunch during these meetings.

terms.definition: Acting as if you're the most important person in a situation
terms.example: She walked in with main character energy, demanding everyone's attention.

terms.definition: Excellent, awesome, or cool
terms.example: That surfing move was totally tubular!

terms.definition: Charisma or charm, especially related to romantic attraction
terms.example: He's got major rizz the way he talks to people at parties.

terms.definition: Impressive, unusual, or extreme
terms.example: That jazz solo was far out, man!

terms.definition: A person who is unreliable, exaggerating, or lying
terms.example: Don't believe him, he's nothing but a jive turkey.

terms.definition: Evidence or proof of something, especially in an argument
terms.example: You said you paid me back but I have the receipts that you didn't.

terms.definition: That makes sense or is consistent with expectations
terms.example: He's late again? Yeah, that tracks.

terms.definition: Resembling or evoking a particular vibe or aesthetic
terms.example: This outfit is giving summer vacation vibes.

terms.definition: A request for someone to calm down or relax
terms.example: Take a chill pill, it's not the end of the world.

terms.definition: Something that is exceptionally good, especially music
terms.example: This new album slaps harder than their last one.

terms.definition: That's the truth or the gossip
terms.example: She broke up with him because he cheated, and that's the tea.

terms.definition: Something that is fake, not genuine, or undesirable
terms.example: That excuse is totally bogus, I know you were at the party.

terms.definition: A threat of physical violence
terms.example: Say that one more time and you'll catch these hands.

terms.definition: Very enthusiastic, interested, or eager
terms.example: I'm keen to try that new restaurant downtown.

terms.definition: When replies to a post outnumber likes, indicating unpopularity
terms.example: His controversial tweet got ratio'd with thousands of angry replies.

terms.definition: Successful in a crucial or critical situation
terms.example: That last-minute goal was so clutch!

terms.definition: When someone or something constantly occupies your thoughts

translations.Boomers: can't get it out of my head

terms.example: That embarrassing moment is living rent free in my mind.

terms.definition: Emotionally intense or serious
terms.example: Wow, that conversation got heavy really fast.

terms.definition: Used to emphasize that a statement is final and not up for debate
terms.example: This is the best movie of the year, periodt.

terms.definition: An affirmative response or agreement
terms.example: Want to get pizza later? Bet!

terms.definition: A dramatic improvement in appearance or confidence
terms.example: His glow up after college was amazing, he looks like a different person.

terms.definition: A quick, witty response to criticism
terms.example: Her clapback to the rude comment left everyone shocked.

terms.definition: High-class, fancy, or luxurious, often in an aspiring way
terms.example: We're going to that boujee new restaurant for my birthday.

terms.definition: Something increasing dramatically in value or popularity
terms.example: That stock is going to the moon this week!

terms.definition: Controversial, risqué, or provocative
terms.example: That was a spicy comment to make in front of the teacher.

terms.definition: Excellent, cool, or impressive
terms.example: Those new sneakers are dope!

terms.definition: To understand the mood or atmosphere of a situation before acting
terms.example: You need to learn to read the room before making jokes like that.

terms.definition: Performed exactly as expected or required
terms.example: Her Halloween costume was perfect, she definitely understood the assignment.

terms.definition: Feeling bitter, angry, or resentful, especially after losing or being criticized
terms.example: He's still salty about not getting invited to the party last week.

terms.definition: A person who is conventional, old-fashioned, or unwilling to take risks
terms.example: Don't be such a square, try something new for once!

terms.definition: Good, fine, or satisfactory
terms.example: No need to apologize, we're gucci.

terms.definition: Excellent or very good at something
terms.example: He's an ace at solving these math problems.

terms.definition: When someone suddenly cuts off all communication without explanation
terms.example: I thought our date went well but then he ghosted me.

terms.definition: When a person is rejected by society or a community due to problematic actions or statements
terms.example: After those offensive tweets resurfaced, he was cancelled immediately.

terms.definition: Something that was once trendy but is now outdated or trying too hard
terms.example: Those Live Laugh Love signs are so cheugy now.

terms.definition: To take a short break
terms.example: Let's take five and then continue with the meeting.

terms.definition: A particularly effective insult or comeback
terms.example: That was a sick burn! He had no response to that.

terms.definition: A dismissive phrase used to mock outdated or closed-minded attitudes
terms.example: He said social media is ruining society, and she just replied 'ok boomer'.

terms.definition: When someone controls access to something by deciding who is worthy
terms.example: Stop gatekeeping the fandom, new fans are allowed to enjoy it too.

terms.definition: Stating something without judgment or criticism
terms.example: No tea, no shade, but that outfit doesn't really work for this occasion.

terms.definition: Exhibiting qualities of the upper middle class; fancy or high-end
terms.example: This restaurant is too bougie for me, I just want a simple burger.

terms.definition: To claim something as yours before anyone else can
terms.example: Dibs on the front seat for the road trip!

terms.definition: Extremely surprised, shocked, or affected by something
terms.example: I was completely shook when I found out the plot twist.

terms.definition: Influence or fame, especially on social media
terms.example: He's just dating her for the clout since she has millions of followers.

terms.definition: Something relatable or representing one's current state of mind
terms.example: That picture of a tired cat sleeping on a keyboard is mood.

terms.definition: To apply makeup skillfully
terms.example: Her makeup is beat to perfection for the wedding.

terms.definition: When something is so funny or shocking it overwhelms you
terms.example: That video of the cat knocking everything off the shelf is sending me.

terms.definition: An expression of excitement, shock, or laughter (often typed rather than spoken)
terms.example: Sksksk I can't believe he said that with a straight face!

terms.definition: Imaginary drug that someone takes to cope with loss or failure
terms.example: He's high on copium thinking his team still has a chance to win.

terms.definition: An expression of disbelief or exaggeration, often in admiration
terms.example: Sheesh! Did you see how high he jumped?

terms.definition: Going to or about to do something
terms.example: I'm finna head out, see you tomorrow.

terms.definition: Flashy, ostentatious jewelry and accessories
terms.example: His new watch is serious bling, must have cost a fortune.

terms.definition: Term used to address someone, often a stranger
terms.example: Listen here, chief, you can't park there.

terms.definition: Term of endearment for a romantic partner (Before Anyone Else)
terms.example: Going to the movies with bae tonight.

terms.definition: Really good, especially referring to food
terms.example: This pizza is bussin no cap!

terms.definition: Perfect or exactly right
terms.example: Your presentation was totally on point today.

terms.definition: Nonsense or foolish talk
terms.example: Don't give me that malarkey, I know you were there!

terms.definition: A term of endearment for a friend (short for family)
terms.example: What's up, fam? Haven't seen you in forever!

terms.definition: Someone who acts like they're the central focus of every situation
terms.example: She's such a main character, making everyone wait while she takes photos.

terms.definition: Expression of excitement or amazement (originally from Twitch)
terms.example: That was pog! Did you see that move he pulled off?

terms.definition: Extremely angry
terms.example: Dad was hopping mad when he saw the dent in his new car.

terms.definition: Admirable and authentic; being true to oneself
terms.example: That's a based opinion, not many people have the courage to say that.

terms.definition: Something that is bad, stupid, or unpleasant
terms.example: That movie was wack, complete waste of money.

terms.definition: To throw something forcefully or discard something carelessly
terms.example: When he saw a spider, he yeeted his phone across the room!

terms.definition: Cool or high quality, especially referring to memes
terms.example: That's a pretty dank meme you made there.

terms.definition: Exceptionally cool or impressive
terms.example: That new skateboard trick was sick!
